definition: to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining

sentences.english: So then, let us not be like others, who are asleep, but let us be alert and self-controlled.
sentences.chinese: 所以我們不要睡覺，像別人一樣，總要儆醒謹守。

sentences.english: Ye observe days, and months, and times, and years.
sentences.chinese: 你們謹守日子，月分，節期，年分。

sentences.english: Therefore let us not sleep, as do others; but let us watch and be sober.
sentences.chinese: 所以我們不要睡覺，像別人一樣，總要儆醒謹守。

sentences.english: Keep my decrees and follow them. I am the Lord , who makes you holy.
sentences.chinese: 你們要謹守我的律例，我是叫你們成聖的耶和華。

sentences.english: The therapeutical principle of syndrome differentiation and disease differentiation should be combined.
sentences.chinese: 治療應謹守病機，辯證與辨病治療相結合。

sentences.english: Keep my commands and follow them.
sentences.chinese: 你們要謹守遵行我的誡命。

sentences.english: I stick to my principles and keep to rule.
sentences.chinese: 我會堅持原則和謹守規則。

sentences.english: Whoso keepeth his mouth and his tongue keepeth his soul from troubles.
sentences.chinese: 謹守口與舌的，就保守自己免受災難。

sentences.english: And now, my children, listen to me: happy are those who keep my ways.
sentences.chinese: 衆子啊，現在要聽從我，因爲謹守我道的，便爲有福。

sentences.english: In school we are taught to get good grades and play by the rules.
sentences.chinese: 在學校裏我們努力獲得好的成績並謹守紀律。

sentences.english: Give ear to me then, my sons: for happy are those who keep my ways.
sentences.chinese: 衆子啊，現在要聽從我，因爲謹守我道的，便爲有福。

sentences.english: Observe the commands of the LORD your God, walking in his ways and revering him.
sentences.chinese: 你要謹守耶和華你神的誡命，遵行他的道，敬畏他。

definition: see 念念不忘[nian4 nian4 bu4 wang4]
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
